poem:
**A Voice in the Crowd**

In the sunlit quadrangle,  
history takes shape,  
her voice a wave  
cresting against silence,  
hands bound by pale plastic;  
truth urgently spoken  
as cameras blink like eyes—  
a ripple in the warm air,  
unfurling against indifference,  
while the heart beats  
its ancient, rebellious drum.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
